p: The theory of planned behavior (TPB) is an extension of the theory of reasoned action [ 10, 11] and is meant to help explain and predict peopleâ€™s intentions and behaviors [ 12]. According to the TPB, attitudes toward behavior, subjective norms (SN), and perceived behavioral control (PBC) are usually found to predict behavioral intentions; moreover, intentions in combination with PBC are then used to explain variance in behavior [ 13].
